snippet: Julie Patz testified about the tragedy that would come to define much of her life and identity: the disappearance of her son in 1979.
abstract: Julie Patz, testifying at murder and kidnapping trial of Pedro Hernandez, describes tragic day in 1979 that her son Etan disappeared; remains composed through difficult narrative in which she recalls her son's loving nature and the budding maturity that led him to go out on errand alone; Patz and her husband Stanley were celebrated for leading political movement to raise national awareness about missing children.
lead_paragraph: Julie Patz testified about the tragedy that would come to define much of her life and identity: the disappearance of her son in 1979.

headline.main: Etan Patz’s Mother Speaks in Court of the Day He Disappeared
headline.print_headline: Mother Tells Jury of Day Etan Patz Disappeared
